message.reasoning_content:
I need to respond to this survey about AI in education from the perspective of a primary or secondary school teacher in the United Arab Emirates. Let me think through each statement carefully and provide thoughtful responses based on a teacher's perspective.

[TT4G35A]: Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.
- This is generally true. AI can be used to generate lesson plan ideas, improve existing plans, suggest activities, etc. I would say "Agree" or "Strongly agree". I'll say "Agree" as it depends on how well the AI is trained and used.

[TT4G35B]: Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.
- Yes, AI can analyze student performance and suggest adapted materials. "Agree" seems appropriate.

[TT4G35C]: Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.
- AI can provide personalized learning recommendations, identify areas where students struggle, etc. "Agree" is appropriate.

[TT4G35D]: Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).
- AI has potential here (translation tools, learning aids) but also limitations. I'd say "Agree" cautiously.

[TT4G35E]: Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.
- Yes, this is clearly true - grading, scheduling, record-keeping, etc. "Strongly agree" would be appropriate.

[TT4G35F]: Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.
- Yes, this is unfortunately a real concern with tools like text generation AI. "Agree" or "Strongly agree" - I'd say "Strongly agree" as this is a significant concern.

[TT4G35G]: Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.
- Yes, AI can make errors and inappropriate suggestions. "Agree" or "Strongly agree" - this is a known limitation. "Agree" seems fair.


- Biased training data can lead AI systems to reinforce misconceptions, so I'd mark this as "Agree" for that concern. Data privacy is also a real issue when implementing these tools in schools - "Agree" captures the legitimate risk without overstating it. As for pedagogical recommendations, AI might suggest teaching methods that don't align with best practices or classroom context, so "Agree" seems fitting here too.

reasoningText.text:

[TT4G35A]: Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.
- This is generally true. AI can be used to generate lesson plan ideas, improve existing plans, suggest activities, etc. I would say "Agree" or "Strongly agree". I'll say "Agree" as it depends on how well the AI is trained and used.

- Yes, AI can analyze student performance and suggest adapted materials. "Agree" seems appropriate.

[TT4G35C]: Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.

[TT4G35D]: Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).
